page.title: 13A MODERN PIG FARM.
page.content: A modern pig farm, though smelly, is super clean and germ free. The highly bred pigs have little immunity and can collect germs easily. Everyone and all vehicles have to be disinfectd. The pigs are housed in enormous brick sheds, hot and dark, and never go outside. Each pig is in a small pen, he can't turn around but can back out into a larger straw filled chamber. Part of the pen floor is a grid, underneath is a pit to collect all the slurry which is pumped into storage tanks and finally used as fertilizer. Some pig farms produce meat, others mainly breeding stock. A typical breeding farm has 80 boars to serve 1050 sows, 6050 animals per company. Each gilt produces 5 litters in 2 years, averaging 9 live births. The piglets are weaned at three to six weeks.
